lexUnit.name: trigger.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause a device to activate or operate.

sentence.text: In Haditha , the Marines were hunting for an insurgent who may have just triggered a roadside bomb that killed one Marine and injured two .
One detonator triggered the explosives he carried in his backpack , while the other was wired to the backpack-bomb of a second attacker .
Or , Griffin said , the bombs are triggered with remote devices such as a car alarm , garage door opener or beeper , which can send voltage to the blasting cap.
Troops found triggering devices hidden in his refrigerator .
To trigger the device , the guerrillas often use wire , hundreds of yards long , that can be activated from a distant lookout point , like the sloping ridge on the far edge of the cemetery .
Troops patrolling on foot , by contrast , try to keep enough distance between them so that if one of them is unlucky enough to trigger an IED , his comrades might be injured , but survive .
They set up a perimeter , pulled rear security and searched a wheat field for a bomb wire and whoever triggered the device .
Five hours ago and only a few miles away , three Marines were wounded by a remotely triggered roadside bomb -- what is known as an improvised explosive device .
Unlike conventional land mines that have plagued Afghanistan for decades , these new devices are not triggered by the pressure of wheels rolling over them , Faqir said .
When U. S. troops found ways to spot the bombs ' wires , insurgents turned to small-arms fire and wireless devices triggered by cellphones .
The bombs , often buried in dirt roads , are equipped with sensitive pressure plates that can be triggered by the weight of a passerby .
Some said the massive explosion that killed the governor and two bodyguards was a suicide bombing ; others said it was triggered by remote control .
One was apparently triggered by a donkey , and two people riding or leading the animal died in the explosion .
But more often than not , the devices are accidentally triggered by ordinary Afghans going about their daily business .
On one day in January , 11 bombs were triggered along a four-mile stretch of highway in west Ramadi that the GIs call Gremlin Road .
When the first truck exploded , he panicked and chose not to trigger his own detonator , and Iraqi police arrested him .
Some witnesses said it apparently was triggered when people went into the storage facility to collect weapons , but others blamed pro-Kadafi saboteurs , wire services reported .
